1 hour ago, AlamoVampire said:

Just so its said: "forum: noun: a place, meeting, or medium where ideas and views on a particular issue can be exchanged."

now that the obvious is said.

we all have a right to put our opinion in writing. We have a right as a paying customer to expect certain things.

We can expect a company to honor its obligations. We can expect the product or service to work as described and sold to us. We have a right to address our concerns to those whom deal with customer concerns. We have a right to demand refunds unless told in a clear and explicit manner to the contrary.

If a company is such that it cannot handle dissenting opinions that it employs methods or agents to silence, abridge, alter or otherwise strike from the public record those dissenting opinions there is a much more serious issue at hand than a game not working in a manner you expect. (Edit not saying thats happening, the action this paragraph describes)

Further it is insulting to those seeking redress to said issues to ignore or tell them to be patient. As said before they like you or I have every right to obtain a product that works correctly and as advertised.

You realize that squad runs these fourms and that you agreed to follow certain rules when you created this account? they are allowed to remove threads, posts and other content that violates this agreement

ok...this is odd. nevertheless.

@insert_name Here is the thing. This is a forum, by its definition, its a way for us to discuss our thoughts and opinions and views. As I said, now I am quoting myself:  We can expect a company to honor its obligations. We can expect the product or service to work as described and sold to us. We have a right to address our concerns to those whom deal with customer concerns. We have a right to demand refunds unless told in a clear and explicit manner to the contrary."

Squad has a reputation. Whether that is good or bad or w/e is what it is. We have a right to expect and DEMAND that what we buy works. period. We have a right to discuss that in a forum, namely THIS forum. It is what a forum is for. You cannot have an honest debate or conversation about something if the company you are discussing consistently removes negative views. It creates a false image, and when more people see said false image, it creates more backlash, more bad press and around we go. Now, is that happening here? Not that I have seen, but, rules or no, it behooves Squad to watch what we say and adjust accordingly. Its good and smart business to do that.

Hiding dissenting opinions, again, ive not seen a whole lot of that here, maybe once or twice, but, something more was wrong with those instances than negative views. 

You would not say, go to a car dealership and buy a car, that is advertised at having 500 bhp and 400mpg only to find out that its 200bhp and 1mpg and NOT create some bad press. its why lemon laws are a thing. The thing is, the climate as a WHOLE in this industry is one where we accept such inaccuracies and games with bugs and the like <by bugs i mean things that shatter the games playability like say the wheel block thing, or the ctd's thats been going on lately as examples> and game companies are complacent that we wont make too much a fuss over it. No. We need to make a fuss, we need to take stands. its the only way the culture we gamers have allowed to happen.

I have to mostly agree with Galileo. This thread was basically done the other day and then for reasons I will likely never understand folks started posting again seemingly for the purpose of riling people up.

At this stage I think it is well known that the console game is broken. Anyone that researches the console version will be able to find sufficient information to inform them of such. I think people's complaints about the console version are valid, but I think they have also been voiced and heard. Also, some people feel Squad isn't the bad guy, some people think Squad is...and both opinions are totally fine! The only option that people have (regardless of platform) are to seek a refund from the vendor they purchased the game from or to wait for the game be patched. Posting additional complaints at this point its ineffective because Squad is already acutely aware of the complaints which, as I mentioned before in the thread, can be evidenced by a patch being in development.

It isn't like the developers are going to see someone post another "the console version is broken" thread and say, "You know, we probably should go ahead and get around to releasing this patch I guess." They'll release it as soon as possible, undoubtedly. By that same logic, no amount of posting "You don't understand Squad! They are amazing and will fix everything just be patient!" will cause someone who is upset and feels they aren't getting their money's worth to suddenly feel mollified. 

What else is there left to say, really?

I think it might be helpful if people take a moment and read through the following blog post. Though ostensibly about "day one patches", it is mostly about the certification process required for console games and, for me at least, answers the "why is this game still on the market place" (we don't want to/can't go through certification again) and "why didn't they put it on Xbox's version of Early Access" (Playstation doesn't have it, and we want to keep everything as similar as possible) questions. 

Certification is not something that makes sure your game is bug free, it's something you have to survive by any means necessary. Once you're through it, no company in their right mind would ever want to take a step backwards and go through it again.

http://www.gamasutra.com/blogs/RamiIsmail/20160807/278721/Patch_the_Process.php
